intro: Phaca trigonocarpa, commonly known as the three-angled phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are three-lobed and arranged in a triangular shape. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Phaca trigonocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
